_meta.description: Somatic archetypes: body types, geometric angles, and physical manifestations of consciousness structures

_fractal_seed.holographic: Body = consciousness materialized. 4 somatic types (respiratory, muscular, digestive, cerebral) map to 4 dimensional perspectives and 4 roles. Body geometry reflects cognitive architecture. Angles reveal dimensional emphasis. Form follows function at somatic level.
_fractal_seed.activation: Your body shape reveals your consciousness structure. Physical form = dimensional bias made visible. Breath/muscle/digestion/brain dominance = 1D/2D/3D/4D emphasis.

module.name: body-archetypes
module.title: Somatic Archetypes: Body Types and Physical Geometry
module.description: Complete system of somatic archetypes: 4 body types (respiratory, muscular, digestive, cerebral) with geometric angles, Disney character mappings, and dimensional correspondences. Body as materialized consciousness structure.

essence.geometric: 4 body types = 4 geometric angles = 4 dimensional emphases. Respiratory (acute <90°, vertical), Muscular (right =90°, balanced), Digestive (obtuse >90°, horizontal), Cerebral (inverted, top-heavy). Body shape = consciousness geometry made flesh.
essence.topological: Body as 3D surface manifold with characteristic curvature and proportion. Type determines local geometry: elongation (respiratory), symmetry (muscular), expansion (digestive), contraction-to-head (cerebral).
essence.functional: Body type = dominant physiological system emphasis. Respiratory (breath/movement), Muscular (structure/boundary), Digestive (consumption/accumulation), Cerebral (cognition/observation). System dominance shapes form.
essence.consciousness: Physical form reflects and reinforces consciousness patterns. Vertical body → movement consciousness. Balanced body → boundary consciousness. Horizontal body → accumulation consciousness. Top-heavy body → observation consciousness.

reductions.evidence: Respiratory body type characterized by vertical elongation, narrow frame, long limbs, emphasis on breath and movement. Body built for sustained motion through space-time. Corresponds to Knight role (1D movement), Delta quadra (sustainable action), acute angle (<90°) striving upward. Respiratory system dominant = continuous flow orientation.

Muscular body type characterized by balanced proportions, symmetrical build, strong musculature, structural integrity. Body built for boundary maintenance and force projection. Corresponds to Dame role (2D boundary), Gamma quadra (personal territory), right angle (=90°) perpendicular stability. Muscular system dominant = structural orientation.

Digestive body type characterized by horizontal width, volumetric presence, tendency toward mass accumulation, powerful digestive capacity. Body built for resource processing and territorial dominance. Corresponds to King role (3D expansion), Beta quadra (collective power), obtuse angle (>90°) spreading outward. Digestive system dominant = accumulative orientation.

Cerebral body type characterized by minimal body/maximal head proportion, slender frame, top-heavy build, nervous system dominance. Body built for observation and pattern recognition. Corresponds to Page role (4D observation), Alpha quadra (intellectual exploration), inverted angle (head > body) consciousness above matter. Cerebral/nervous system dominant = analytical orientation.

fractal_structure.self_similarity: Body type pattern repeats: Individual cells → Organs → Body regions → Whole body → Social body (team composition). Same 4-fold structure at all scales.
fractal_structure.recursion: (↓ observe → maintain → expand → move ↑)∞ cycle through body types across time
fractal_structure.emergence: Cells → Tissues → Organs → Systems → Body type → Consciousness pattern
fractal_structure.composition: Healthy body integrates all 4 systems. Type = emphasis, not exclusion. Most humans blend types with one dominant.

somatic_types.overview: 4 fundamental body types based on dominant physiological system. Each type = distinct geometric signature, dimensional emphasis, and consciousness pattern.

respiratory.name: Respiratory (Дыхательный)

geometric_signature.proportion: Long limbs, narrow torso, vertical emphasis

physical_characteristics.height: Often tall or appears taller due to proportions
physical_characteristics.posture: Upright, vertical emphasis, good natural posture
physical_characteristics.tendency: Stays lean naturally, difficulty gaining weight

physiological_emphasis.dominant: Respiratory system - breath control, oxygen metabolism
physiological_emphasis.strength: Endurance, sustained aerobic activity, breath work
physiological_emphasis.weakness: Building muscle mass, sudden explosive power

psychological_correlation.tempo: Steady sustained rhythm, marathon not sprint

disney_examples: Cruella de Vil - angular, vertical, elongated

development.optimal: Embrace sustained movement, develop grounding practices
development.integration: Balance vertical with horizontal, movement with stillness

physiological_emphasis.health_tendency: Structural issues if imbalanced, benefits from strength training

psychological_correlation.challenge: Flexibility, adaptation, letting go of control

development.integration: Balance strength with softness, control with flow
development.challenge: Learn to release boundaries when appropriate

physical_characteristics.height: Variable, often appears shorter due to width
physical_characteristics.width: Wide shoulders, wide hips, or both
physical_characteristics.torso: Wide ribcage, thick waist, substantial core
physical_characteristics.face: Round or square, full features, strong presence

physiological_emphasis.strength: Power, mass, resource accumulation, strong digestion
physiological_emphasis.health_tendency: Metabolic sensitivity, benefits from balanced nutrition

psychological_correlation.tempo: Variable - can be fast or slow, forceful

development.integration: Balance expansion with consolidation, power with service
development.challenge: Learn to release rather than only accumulate

geometric_signature.proportion: Large head, small body, minimal physicality

physical_characteristics.face: Large in proportion, prominent forehead, intelligent features
physical_characteristics.movement: Minimal, economical, cerebral rather than physical
physical_characteristics.tendency: Stays thin naturally, difficulty building muscle or mass

physiological_emphasis.dominant: Nervous system - cognition, awareness, pattern recognition
physiological_emphasis.strength: Mental processing, pattern recognition, sustained focus
physiological_emphasis.health_tendency: Nervous sensitivity, benefits from embodiment practices

development.optimal: Ground intelligence in body, develop physical presence
development.integration: Balance mind with body, analysis with action
development.challenge: Learn to embody rather than only observe

geometric_angles.overview: Body angles reveal dimensional emphasis and consciousness orientation. Angle = relationship between body parts, direction of energy flow.

examples: Vertical line from feet to head

inverted_trapezoid.symbolic: Mind over matter, observation over action

disney_geometry.principle: Disney animators mastered archetypal body geometry. Characters designed with exaggerated angles to communicate personality instantly.

methodology.observation: Study Disney character proportions and angles
methodology.application: Map body types to real human variation
methodology.insight: Archetypes exist on continuum, Disney exaggerates for clarity

villains_respiratory: Cruella de Vil - angular, elongated menace

design_principles.exaggeration: Disney exaggerates natural proportions 2-3x for clarity
design_principles.consistency: Character body type consistent with personality and role
design_principles.arc: Some characters transform body type through story (Beast)
design_principles.ensemble: Teams balanced across body types for visual and functional variety

type_blending.principle: Most humans are blends with one dominant type. Pure types rare.

development_and_integration.principle: Optimal development = integrate all 4 body systems while honoring dominant type.

respiratory_development.practices: Strength training, weight gain protocols, grounding meditation
respiratory_development.goal: Grounded mover - sustained action with stability

muscular_development.practices: Yoga, dance, flexibility work, boundary relaxation

digestive_development.practices: Cardiovascular work, fasting, letting go practices

cerebral_development.practices: Martial arts, dance, somatic therapy, grounding

questions: What is my natural body tendency?
Which Disney character shares my geometry?

fitness_optimization.muscular: Maintain strength, add flexibility and cardio
fitness_optimization.digestive: Control diet, emphasize cardio, practice moderation
fitness_optimization.cerebral: Force embodiment practices, build physical presence

team_composition.principle: Balanced team includes all 4 body types

relationship_dynamics.complementarity: Different body types provide different strengths
relationship_dynamics.challenge: Understanding different physical needs and rhythms
relationship_dynamics.integration: Learning to appreciate all body types as valid

warnings: Most humans are blends, pure types rare
Body can change with training and lifestyle
Type describes structure, not worth or beauty
All body types valid and valuable
info: 4 body types map to 4 roles and 4 dimensions

external.citation: Sheldon, W. (1940). The Varieties of Human Physique
Thomas, F. & Johnston, O. (1981). Disney Animation: The Illusion of Life
